oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Chet Atkins - Parts 1, 2 and 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Chet Atkins (performer) for the Ralph Emery Show. Tape labeled parts 1, 2 and 3. Recording is from May 03, 1983.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Chet Atkins radio spot for the Ralph Emery Show -- (00:10) Atkins radio spot for the Ralph Emery Show -- (00:24) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery introduction voiceover] -- (01:02) Emery inquires about Atkins' health, and Atkins possibly touring -- (01:54) Emery and Atkins introduce "Yakety Axe" -- (02:23) Atkins says praise of Janie Fricke while introducing "He's a Heartache (Looking For a Place to Happen)" -- (02:53) Emery invites Atkins to reflect on the idea of being a 'star;' additionally, Emery inquires about the tag CGP Atkins places on his album -- (04:37) Emery invites Atkins to reflect on his first album with RCA: Work it Out With Chet Atkins -- (06:40) Emery questions Atkins about his ability to play duel tracks -- (08:03) Emery invites Atkins to recall talking to Leona Williams and Merle Haggard while introducing "We're Strangers Again" -- (08:39) Emery asks Atkins about the first time he met Dolly Parton -- (09:21) Emery questions the process Atkins took for transferring from RCA to CBS, and Atkins leaving his guitar company -- (11:41) Emery chooses to bring up Working it Out With Chet Atkins again; additionally, Atkins' health is discussed -- (14:20) Emery and Atkins discuss the need for walking -- (15:31) Emery inquires about the first group to release "Oh Baby Mine" -- (16:08) Emery inquires about the background vocalists for "Freight Train" -- (17:05) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery and Chet Atkins outro voiceover] -- (18:17) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery and Chet Atkins introduction voiceover] -- (18:52) Emery and Atkins discuss Atkins' discomfort to being a member of the Country Music Hall of Fame -- (19:59) Emery introduces Atkins' CBS album -- (21:11) Emery has Atkins' discuss the various ways one can cause an instrument to 'talk' -- (23:20) Emery and Atkins describe the 'Chase' and "The Streakin' Melody" -- (23:55) Emery reads a verse of Atkins to him, and Atkins remembers Parton -- (27:19) Emery inquires about the amount of Willie Nelson's songs that Atkins produced; additionally, Emery dives into the contents of Atkins' album -- (29:05) Emery inquires about where Atkins grew up, and if Atkins almost died as a child -- (30:58) Emery inquires about the peculiarities of musicians -- (33:03) Emery asks about Atkins about his greatest thrills -- (35:01) Emery praises Atkins' version of "Snow Bird" -- (35:57) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery and Chet Atkins outro voiceover] -- (37:13) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery and Chet Atkins introduction voiceover] -- (37:40) Emery and Atkins discuss Jim Glaser and Atkins' "Frog Kissing" -- (41:09) Emery and Atkins reflect on the first time Atkins was asked to perform on Garrison Keillor's radio show; additionally, both introduce "Country Gentleman" -- (42:57) Emery inquires about the possibility of Atkins working on albums, including Work It Out With Chet Atkins -- (44:56) Emery inquires about the words "I Can't Sleep" on the back of his album, and how writers sensationalize topics when talking about Elvis Presley -- (47:30) Emery inquires about if Atkins knows about Michael Murphey -- (48:11) Emery praises Atkins when discussing "Cascade" -- (49:09) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Ralph Emery and Chet Atkins outro voiceover]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Atkins, Chet;
